page.title: 20Potterspury Schools
page.content: The present school was founded by the Duke of Grafton and the Rev. Hellins with help from the National Society and a new building was erected in 1817. It is still in use. Fifty boys attended but no girls. A Sunday School was run by the Duke's daughters and the vicar's wife for the girls. The first headmaster was a Mr Hall who came from London. A girls and infants schools were added in 1863. The three schools were combined in 1910. New buildings were added in 1972 and in 1980 the old part of the school was remodelled. The school was an all-age school until 1958 when the new school was opened at Deanshanger. The school is now called Potterspury County Primary School. There are about 140 children on roll at present.The Head's name is Mr J D Clamp and there are five other teachers.
